subs.text: It would be a good idea to read up on how Ukraine got rid of their Putin-infested government. We need to do that here in the US and elsewhere in the west.
subs.rawText: It would be a good idea to read up on how Ukraine got rid of their Putin-infested government. We need to do that here in the US and elsewhere in the west.

subs.text: What they learned in Ukraine is that if you have a choice between giving free speech to people who are actively trying to undermine your political system you must sacrifice free speech not your political system.
subs.rawText: What they learned in Ukraine is that if you have a choice between giving free speech to people who are actively trying to undermine your political system you must sacrifice free speech not your political system.

subs.text: @matty8r it's not a matter of software, we have the software, it's a matter of finding the right people willing to try who really have a common mission and will put the time into it.
subs.rawText: @matty8r it's not a matter of software, we have the software, it's a matter of finding the right people willing to try who really have a common mission and will put the time into it.

subs.text: @bvschroeder I think we're getting close. Hey I've really enjoyed this collaboration. Just want to say thanks. ;-)

subs.text: I don't see why we have anything invested in Twitter continuing to work. What's the benefit? Are we dealing with our planet-scale problems any better that we would without it? Maybe letting it fall apart is the best thing. [link]
subs.rawText:
I don't see why we have anything invested in Twitter continuing to work. What's the benefit? Are we dealing with our planet-scale problems any better that we would without it? Maybe letting it fall apart is the best thing.

subs.text: @marshallk there are laws about this btw and they vary from state to state. my company was in calif, where the laws favor the employee.

subs.text: @marshallk hard to say. i had it happen twice. once with my vp-sales going to our chief competitor who was kicking our ass. it looked terrible, beyond whatever secrets he took with him.
subs.rawText: @marshallk hard to say. i had it happen twice. once with my vp-sales going to our chief competitor who was kicking our ass. it looked terrible, beyond whatever secrets he took with him.

subs.text: @marshallk also had apple hire away a developer who i assigned to work on a project with apple. made it hard to trust them.

subs.text:
@bvschroeder Here's another clue. 

I pasted the text from the tweet into a new tweet here on twitter and it worked. 

i tried the same on a different website with a standard text edit box in chrome and it was mangled.

which strongly suggests it's a font issue. ;-)
subs.rawText:
@bvschroeder Here's another clue. 

I pasted the text from the tweet into a new tweet here on twitter and it worked. 

i tried the same on a different website with a standard text edit box in chrome and it was mangled.

which strongly suggests it's a font issue. ;-)

subs.text:
@bvschroeder From the CSS styles for the Wordle boxes.

font-family: TwitterChirp, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
subs.rawText:
@bvschroeder From the CSS styles for the Wordle boxes.

subs.text: @marcedavis Also there was the perfect opportunity to do so, when government officials started posting official documents to @medium. Even the then-president, Obama, did it as did the Speaker of the House. That should not have been allowed.
subs.rawText: @marcedavis Also there was the perfect opportunity to do so, when government officials started posting official documents to @medium. Even the then-president, Obama, did it as did the Speaker of the House. That should not have been allowed.

subs.text: @marcedavis @Medium Also the Library of Congress started archiving tweets. Ridiculous. Another clear signal that something bigger was called for.
subs.rawText: @marcedavis @Medium Also the Library of Congress started archiving tweets. Ridiculous. Another clear signal that something bigger was called for.

subs.text: Why isn't something like this thread amplified in the form of a commercial that runs on CNN, MSNBC and Fox every night until Congress acts? When are we going to organize some of the energy here or are we all just going to be screaming in pain at each other. [link]
